data.text:
Refugees have demonstrated extraordinary solidarity throughout the #COVID19 pandemic.

From doctors & nurses, to mask & soap makers - refugee frontline workers have stepped up & made a difference to help keep people safe from #coronavirus. via @Refugees. https://t.co/mP1GV0oBUp

Ensuring healthy lives & promoting well-being at all ages is essential for a better world.

The UN supplies vaccines for about half of the world’s children, helping to save 3 million lives a year. https://t.co/jWlwtqXf1F #UN75 https://t.co/tQac7Gs431

Calling all photographers: the annual @WMO photo competition is open for entries!

This year's theme is "The Ocean, our climate and weather." Winning entries will appear in the 2021 WMO calendar. Details: https://t.co/BZUCKEOhj8 https://t.co/NPfBE0k9Nb

#FBF to 1947 when artist Hugh Ferriss drew this sketch of the UN Permanent Headquarters, to be erected in NYC. Also shown is the iconic building after completion.

75 years after its creation, the UN continues to work for everyone, everywhere. https://t.co/V4DSdQmu9c https://t.co/hkEtLITFkx

World leaders underscore their commitment towards fast-tracking & fully funding the development & production of #COVID19 tests, medicines & vaccines, to be made available to everyone, everywhere.
https://t.co/CNbQM5LbeL

"There are people who are dying after following misinformation."

Dr. @hollyseale and MD @saifsociologist talk about the devastating effect #COVID19 misinformation can have on people & communities.

Sign up to help share life-saving facts: https://t.co/dviRSvpBON https://t.co/e5Xx69i56g

How could the lessons learned from the fight against HIV help inform a people-centred response to #COVID19, while also re-imagining health systems?

New @UNAIDS report explains: https://t.co/Oi1nHERPyp https://t.co/t0mxy1W4oZ

Suicide is a global public health issue that affects all ages, sexes & regions of the world.

More from @WHO on Thursday's World #SuicidePrevention Day. https://t.co/5E1RUC5Ugc https://t.co/NsDs07cP6G

👩‍🌾 Farmers
🚛 Truck drivers
🛒 Grocery store workers 

... and other #FoodHeroes are ensuring safe & nutritious food is available, despite #COVID19. 

We can all support them & create more sustainable food systems. @FAO explains how: https://t.co/HkDdPcaun2 https://t.co/EMh4ErKYZX

Every 40 seconds, someone, somewhere in the world, dies by suicide. 

On Thursday's #SuicidePrevention Day, @WHO has ideas on how you can support someone who may be considering suicide. https://t.co/ZcHB6gqxWQ https://t.co/rdSM9BohxI

#COVID19 may have disrupted many aspects of daily life, but efforts to protect & advance women's rights continue. 

Join @UN_Women & celebrate some accomplishments & other good news about gender equality.

https://t.co/C1bAAkn2Tn

Thursday is #SuicidePrevention Day.

Find out what you can do if you think someone is considering suicide: https://t.co/ZcHB6gI9lq via @WHO https://t.co/KrYN5EXS8R

Inadequate economic & political action, health inequities coupled with erosion of trust in public institutions amid #COVID19 could push more countries into violence — top UN officials warn Security Council.
https://t.co/kwNBmLq6AD

Close to 800,000 people die by suicide each year.

On Thursday's World #SuicidePrevention Day, get more facts and guidance on how to support those who may be considering suicide. https://t.co/woEw9EL1yF via @WHO https://t.co/fLuaVMtgFo

The climate emergency has not stopped for #COVID19. 

We need science, solidarity & solutions to tackle both of these global crises.  

Find out more in @WMO's "United in Science" report: https://t.co/CEkS3xAAfX #ClimateAction https://t.co/QkKK5Du7KQ

🗣️Your voice matters,
💭Your ideas matter.
Now — more than ever,

Tune in to watch the #UN75 Youth Plenary and share your vision for the future you want and the UN you need: https://t.co/YjWHg0otxF https://t.co/j2yAbdktQc

More than 22,000 students & educators were attacked in the past 5 years. 

Schools & universities should always be safe havens - never targets.

More on Wednesday's first-ever #ProtectEducationFromAttack Day: https://t.co/bMwY3XXN2O https://t.co/h92HJlpjkC

It makes public health sense to help all countries fight #COVID19. 
It makes economic sense to act promptly & generously in the most fragile settings to prevent the worst scenarios.

-- @UNReliefChief calls for global solidarity in @_UNChronicle: https://t.co/lZu2PNzVzP

Attacks on schools, students & educators are attacks on children’s right to education & on their futures.

On Wednesday's first-ever #ProtectEducationFromAttack Day, see how @UNESCO works to make education a safe place for everyone, everywhere. https://t.co/iNkkE7PoM0 https://t.co/xgLTdqaFYt

Misinformation is causing global harm, hampering our ability to make progress on many of the world’s most pressing issues.

So take time to verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/fL1nNM92od

Children and youth in conflict zones remain among the most vulnerable to the devastating impact of #COVID19. 

Education can be a life saver.

More on Wednesday's first-ever #ProtectEducationFromAttack Day: https://t.co/bMwY3XXN2O https://t.co/96Vxy2usgf

8,000km long 🌳 
15km wide 🌱 

The Great Green Wall is designed to be a mosaic of trees, grasslands, vegetation & plants along the southern tip of the Saharan desert in Africa.

@UNCCD has the latest on the project: https://t.co/HIsIGEEJh6 https://t.co/hutbzvxv2L

Pre-existing conditions can worsen the severity of the #coronavirus. 

To stay fit:
🍐 Eat healthy
🚭 Don't smoke
🏃‍♀️ Exercise regularly
🍺 Limit alcohol intake

More tips in latest UN report on non-communicable diseases & #COVID19. https://t.co/C7CGSMINaV https://t.co/9v3D6k6bq0

The UN and people around the world are demonstrating the power of solidarity amid the #COVID19 crisis.

Find hope & good news in our latest @Twitter moment 👇
https://t.co/0fAkEX0y1W

As the world responds to #COVID19, our efforts to advance literacy cannot slow down.
 
On Tuesday's #LiteracyDay, see how @UNESCO works to ensure literacy for everyone, everywhere. https://t.co/WfU2m6Pm5v https://t.co/QllDzPXE8M

🌱I am life.
🌱I have been around for longer than you can imagine. 
🌱I am home to millions. 
🌱I cover much of the earth.

Your life relies on mine. I am worth protecting.

I am plants. 🌱🌱

https://t.co/7xo7sxXFFr #PlantHealth via @FAO https://t.co/dtbkEbWRd3

Nearly 773 million adults & young people worldwide lack literacy skills, & are unable to access life-saving information during #COVID19.

On Tuesday's #LiteracyDay, see how @UNESCO is helping: https://t.co/WfU2m6Pm5v https://t.co/gu8nPHZ2pA

From supporting desperate families fleeing their homes to raising awareness about their plight, @Refugees' Boris @cheshirkov has devoted his life to helping the most vulnerable.

🎧 Listen to his story in the Awake At Night podcast with @MelissaFleming: https://t.co/ou3WCHSpQw https://t.co/IqMz1oLXI6

Learning how to read & write should be a significant milestone for everyone. But, millions of adults & youth lack basic literacy skills. 
 
On Tuesday's #LiteracyDay, join @UNESCO to help promote literacy & learning for all: https://t.co/9y15vOds2w https://t.co/YVTdny5dXL

#COVID19 has exposed the fragility of our world. 

As we sow the seeds to shape our future beyond the #coronavirus pandemic, the #GlobalGoals remain our best road map to recover better.
https://t.co/1dDso3XhD9 https://t.co/R1kgno3Xz0

As we work together to develop a #COVID19 vaccine, we must ensure that it is truly a people's vaccine - accessible to everyone, everywhere.

-- @antonioguterres on the need for international solidarity in the development of safe & effective #coronavirus vaccine & treatment.

In Haiti, @UNFPA is supporting health workers & midwives to ensure safe access to maternal health services & to encourage pregnant women to continue receiving care during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/lMhHZBcol7 https://t.co/IYVZYtWaQA

"As we recover from the #coronavirus pandemic, the world needs to pay far greater attention to air pollution, which also increases the risks associated with #COVID19."

-- @antonioguterres on Monday's first-ever #WorldCleanAirDay: https://t.co/2S3R0xVvSG https://t.co/4amAEp5g2L

🌊Decreased river flows
🌡️ Temperatures rises
🦥 Disappearing wildlife

After witnessing effects of the climate crisis in Costa Rica, Don Jesús took #ClimateAction by promoting resilience & protecting long-term water supplies, with support from @UNDP. https://t.co/dGvKg4kcMf

Here are some actions you can take on Monday's #WorldCleanAirDay and every day:

🌳 Plant more trees
🗑️ Clean up trash
🚵‍♀️ Commute without polluting

More ideas from @UNEP: https://t.co/kEPVnMhYOc #CleanAirForAll https://t.co/dDz6ULzZIC

Interested in working at the UN? The Young Professionals Programme is now open for applications through 31 October. 

Get application tips from @UN_Careers: https://t.co/vSg7fXXIwp https://t.co/J6xAu8qjXY

Around the world, 9 out of 10 people breathe unclean air, which can cause heart disease, strokes, lung cancer & other respiratory diseases.

More on achieving #CleanAirForAll on Monday's first-ever #WorldCleanAirDay: https://t.co/WDSv2JnF8e https://t.co/5slk1PGNCC

Misinformation is causing global harm, hampering our ability to make progress on many of the world’s most pressing issues.

We can all help. Pause & take time to verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/9cNARG43wd #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/EwMruYLy8P

When a girl’s education is cut short, the impact on communities lasts for generations.

Help @UNESCO ensure #LearningNeverStops for every girl throughout the #COVID19 crisis: https://t.co/gX1AUOWPZg https://t.co/mHiv5JqNyv

Prevent ↔️ prepare ↔️ detect ↔️ respond

See how Viet Nam implemented one of the world’s most successful responses to the #COVID19 pandemic, through early interventions and by strengthening health systems. 

https://t.co/78O2G0OJr8

The #GlobalGoals are our blueprint for achieving a better world and a healthier planet. 

Check out our latest virtual exhibit that brings the  Goals to life through powerful photos from around the world. https://t.co/So8ruQf7cE https://t.co/ptUIIpBAuQ

#COVID19 has put a spotlight on the digital divide between countries and regions - making closing this gap more urgent than ever. 

More from @_GenUnlimited: https://t.co/VdqZEaOLZ8 https://t.co/UnFTKNYRbp

The UN works for everyone, everywhere by: 
🇺🇳 preventing conflict
🇺🇳 vaccinating children
🇺🇳 protecting refugees
🇺🇳 feeding the hungry
🇺🇳 addressing the climate crisis
🇺🇳 empowering women
🇺🇳 responding to humanitarian crises & so much more. 

https://t.co/IUYTNM5eVG #UN75 https://t.co/V7DrOXuW5Q

#COVID19 threatens to make gender poverty gaps worse than before the pandemic.

@UN_Women and @UNDP are calling on governments to take urgent action. https://t.co/vDIbQ7u4PD https://t.co/AgxfJw7AR4

🚢 🔀🏫 

In Bangladesh, @UNICEF is using ships to build safe and sustainable schools for Rohingya refugee children. https://t.co/NmMo7iFXUL
On Saturday's International #CharityDay, we thank everyone who helps make the world a better place, especially amid #COVID19. https://t.co/IIg76jUlVt https://t.co/i8B4YB7DDz

🔹 29+ million people saved & protected
🔹 49 countries supported

In 2019, @UNCERF used US$539 to #InvestInHumanity. Get details here: https://t.co/atNyiTDqaO https://t.co/iUEJcBBqX8
Mother Teresa's selfless work helped inspire the creation of Saturday's #CharityDay. More here: https://t.co/SN3i3eeiwj https://t.co/MFEk9KhGgX

Violence against women is not inevitable. There are things all of us can do to break down this vicious cycle; and understanding the root causes is the first step. Learn more from @UN_Women: https://t.co/vVzffsF4LN https://t.co/tRQ0nWafLE

Change starts with you.  

On Saturday's International #CharityDay, get ideas for how you can help transform our world: https://t.co/SN3i3evTnR #GlobalGoals https://t.co/pVqtSAvbkr

"We need to take the opportunity of an economic reset to ensure the rights to life, dignity, and security for everyone."

-- @antonioguterres on #COVID19 recovery. https://t.co/ppSUGLIDO5 https://t.co/vuQUVgqQkj

Charity can help alleviate humanitarian crises and human suffering, especially during the #COVID19 crisis. 

On Saturday's #CharityDay, find out how you can support the work of the UN: https://t.co/ERVBc7u2HM https://t.co/zK1tRnij5j

Good news from Côte d’Ivoire: The country has adopted Africa’s first legal process to address statelessness, helping end the limbo for thousands without a nationality. #IBelong via @Refugees 
https://t.co/kkOXFbWFzX

Sexual health requires a positive approach to sexuality and is fundamental to the overall health & well-being of individuals, couples & families.

More from @WHO on Friday's World Sexual Health Day: https://t.co/Yt76gPxaDa

"Like me, every other polio vaccinator is fighting a war like a soldier too."

— Health worker Khalida shares how she and her colleagues help tackle polio in Pakistan. 

#VaccinesWork https://t.co/TcNBcC6WCA

The global shift towards #ClimateAction is gathering pace because leaders everywhere are realizing that clean energy delivers more jobs, cleaner air, better health & stronger economic growth.

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/T12AmfcFW9 https://t.co/IRmvfWQlUW

80% of newborn deaths are preventable with proven, cost-effective interventions. 

New @WHO & @UNICEF report outlines measures to ensure high-quality maternal & newborn health care is accessible to all. https://t.co/SiGTfD4B70

Number of hungry people in the world will reach 840 million by 2030 if current trends continue.

@WFP's latest Hunger Map shows prevalence of undernourishment in each country, providing invaluable information about the biggest single risk to global health. https://t.co/LVTvRtyfV6 https://t.co/ilxbubTpT1

"#COVID19 respects no borders – and that demands that we strengthen cooperation across our own."

-- @antonioguterres calls for international collaboration and solidarity. https://t.co/ivMh3uORT3 https://t.co/H6rpa1WOnd

“We remain in this together, as nations, united."

-- @UN_PGA at the opening of the first in-person #UNGA meeting since the start of the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/HuYMoErxu4 https://t.co/Xeqoq5sGxs

Education has the power to open doors & fulfill dreams.
Education is a human right.
Yet 48% of refugee children are out of school.

New @Refugees report highlights steps to improve access to inclusive, quality education for all: https://t.co/7Yk9PbJA1x

https://t.co/5Z8d1drupc

"We are facing two critical crises, #COVID19 and climate change.
  
Let us tackle both and leave future generations with the hope that this moment is a true turning point for people and planet."

-- @antonioguterres #ClimateAction
https://t.co/gAKeIkFL8j

"Some Governments appear to have seized on the #COVID19 crisis as an excuse for much wider – and unjustifiable – crackdowns on criticism & dissent." 

–- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet stresses importance of freedom of expression & the press.
https://t.co/cYc8fznf7s

#TBT to 1947 when the official UN flag was approved with olive branches symbolizing peace around the world. 

As the UN turns 75, we continue to work for peace, dignity and equality on a healthy planet. https://t.co/uKqX2tHgU7 #UN75 https://t.co/jVi60pRcdD

“Libya is indeed at a decisive turning point."

-- Following the call for a ceasefire by rival political leaders, top UN official in the country urges Security Council to press for an immediate de-escalation of tensions & a return to negotiations. https://t.co/Yo38y05tir

If we are to meet global challenges, from the climate crisis to growing inequality & the digital divide, we must join together, rejecting sexist & ageist stereotypes that prevent women – and men – from realizing our full humanity.

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/ppSUGLIDO5 https://t.co/Fks7wtiHiI

Terrorists are exploiting hardships caused by #COVID19 to radicalize & recruit. There is an urgent need for global unity & solidarity against violent extremism.

-@antonioguterres on need to put people first in #COVID19 response & fight against terrorism. https://t.co/byXGRzRf4a https://t.co/oSr1e8tQXh

2020's extreme summer had a major impact on ice shelves and glaciers, @WMO warns.

Details about effects on Arctic ice, as well as in Siberia, Canada, Iceland and European Alps: https://t.co/KUOeCuVVEQ #ClimateAction https://t.co/wnE1ISFQWq

Switzerland 🇨🇭 
Sweden 🇸🇪 
USA 🇺🇸 
UK 🇬🇧 
Netherlands 🇳🇱
are the world’s innovation leaders, says Global Innovation Index 2020.

More from @WIPO on the effects of #COVID19 on innovation: https://t.co/1ivojWE2fP https://t.co/Fq3upAniCp

#COVID19 threatens to make gender poverty gaps worse than before the pandemic. 

@UN_Women and @UNDP call on governments to take urgent action. https://t.co/vDIbQ7u4PD https://t.co/qZioVp8yZg

Misinformation is causing global harm, hampering our ability to make progress on many of the world’s most pressing issues.

So pause & take time to verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/9cNARG43wd #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/BWGdwIxt3l

Sudan: Severe flooding has killed 90 people and affected 380,000 others. 

The UN is helping support the most vulnerable with emergency shelter, household supplies, water, sanitation, food, health services & more. 
https://t.co/WHhg9Kts4b

Solidarity, support and kindness are much needed during the #COVID19 pandemic. Get inspired by the examples in this @Twitter moment:
https://t.co/cqLTHBhwip

"People have forgotten that we are each other's keepers."

-- @UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador @IshmaelBeah spoke with UN Messenger of Peace Michael Douglas about racial justice and #COVID19 as part of @LiberatumGlobal Lifesaving Conversations. https://t.co/Gw3inUrfIu https://t.co/nsYBTovo7c

#COVID19 is deepening gender inequality. 
We are seeing a reversal in decades of fragile progress on gender equality & women’s rights. And without a concerned response, we risk losing a generation or more of gains.

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/WP4vEyW3Gj https://t.co/knE23IfUS7

Half of the world is not connected and in danger of being left behind.

Giving every young person access to internet, modern education & entrepreneurship can be the greatest equalizer.

Find out how @_GenUnlimited is working towards that goal: https://t.co/VdqZEaOLZ8 https://t.co/DB2wBMbRb4

September marks the 5th anniversary of the #GlobalGoals - the to-do list for a better and more sustainable future for all. 

From taking #ClimateAction to speaking out against injustice, we all have a role to play in transforming our world. https://t.co/lcP8Yz0K5m https://t.co/F85txo8elg
Niger assumes the presidency of the Security Council for the month of September. Follow @Niger_ONU for updates: https://t.co/b3Pnk9jtsW https://t.co/jeG9W1y26v
A peace agreement between Sudanese authorities and armed groups from Darfur could provide a path to national unity, says head of @unamidnews. https://t.co/kyn31upHJo

The #COVID19 crisis threatens decades of progress made towards gender equality, putting over 11 million girls at risk of not returning to school.

Help @UNESCO ensure that #LearningNeverStops for every girl. https://t.co/5UbqXjkPXg https://t.co/viCzxghPeZ

#COVID19 is exposing & exacerbating considerable hurdles women face in achieving their rights & fulfilling their potential.
Progress lost may take years, even generations, to recover. 

-- @antonioguterres calls for protection of rights of women & girls. https://t.co/ppSUGLr2Wx https://t.co/Z2r78VFUbI

🧴 Wash your hands frequently
🤭 Avoid touching your face
🤧 Cover your cough
👥👥 Avoid crowded places
🏠 Stay home if unwell

More tips from @WHO to protect yourself & others during #COVID19: https://t.co/w3s3KMGzbj

https://t.co/56eSr8q2lZ

Food safety helps:
🤒 Prevent food-borne illness
🌱 Sustain life & enable healthy diet
🥦🫕 Safely produce & prepare food
💵 Facilitate trade 
🗑️ Reduce food waste

More from @FAO: https://t.co/zpjduNPyN2 https://t.co/Ps0qhapR9m

Human rights belong to everyone, everywhere - no matter who you are or whom you love.

❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

Join UN @free_equal in the fight against transphobia & homophobia: https://t.co/Ljui9G92Ag #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/iWxOaUCkat

Indigenous peoples are at disproportionate risk in public health emergencies such as #COVID19.

Follow @UN4Indigenous for updates on the #coronavirus crisis and its impact on indigenous communities. https://t.co/BbVZ4ubnay https://t.co/GqzoqEYDaQ

Around the world, @UNVolunteers are on the frontlines of the fight against #COVID19.

We thank these real life heroes who dedicate their lives to helping others. https://t.co/Hyx3fW2y7s https://t.co/jXjv4yZJPB

The #COVID19 crisis is resulting in a shadow pandemic - an increase in gender-based violence worldwide. 

We can and must prevent violence against women everywhere. 

Get details & resources from @UN_Women: https://t.co/WajNc21kt6 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/lyyxfzTqDm

What we share online can have consequences in the real world. 

Pause - and verify facts before sharing. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare. 

https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN https://t.co/6XtAPJwLeV

"Investments in renewable energy generate three times more jobs than investments in polluting fossil fuels."

-- @antonioguterres calls for smarter, stronger, clearner economies for the 21st century. https://t.co/fzFB4qFz86 #ClimateAction https://t.co/LrQJMDZBJN

"Let us renew our commitment to end all enforced disappearances."

-- @antonioguterres on Sunday's International Day of the Victims of Enforced Disappearances. https://t.co/JEGGbZExRp https://t.co/HWKrn7YHBR

Pakistan & Afghanistan are the only two countries in the world where polio is still endemic, partly due to misinformation.

Find out how @UNICEF works to counter misconceptions and save lives. https://t.co/HGx02ZAEMw #VaccinesWork https://t.co/brUWPFQlCz

Sunday is the International Day of Victims of Enforced Disappearances. 

Stand up for the rights of the disappeared today & every day: https://t.co/iqJLnxFXs2 #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/tyJoUCsAI3

8 million tonnes of plastic enter our oceans every year, harming hundreds of marine species. 

On Sunday's #WhaleSharkDay, find out from @UNEP's @andersen_inger how you can help #BeatPlasticPollution: https://t.co/ojzREV936q

No circumstance can justify someone's disappearance. 

Sunday is the International Day of Victims of Enforced Disappearances. https://t.co/JEGGbZW8IX https://t.co/HfYsgVOPHy

"It is imperative that we rebuild tourism in a safe, equitable and climate friendly way."

-- @antonioguterres on the need to support the recovery of the tourism sector, following devastating losses due to #COVID19. https://t.co/QswSypQSCE https://t.co/cAJIjMrlh8
